p: Incidents are managed through “routine” measures, that is, those that are already established and immediately applicable, such as (1) pharmacovigilance and quality/manufacturing monitoring tools, for example, carrying out of inspections (2) regulatory tools enabling action, for example, variation, suspension, or revocation of the marketing authorization, and (3) communications aimed at patients and healthcare professionals, for example, press release, questions and answers (Q&A) documents, Direct Healthcare Professional Communication (DHPC), and so on.
